symbols.name: The Green Light
symbols.description: A green light at the end of Daisy's dock that Gatsby watches from his mansion.
symbols.meaning: Represents Gatsby's hopes and dreams for the future, particularly his desire to reunite with Daisy.
symbols.key_quote: Gatsby believed in the green light, the orgastic future that year by year recedes before us.

references.description: Gatsby reaching out towards the green light.

symbols.name: The Valley of Ashes
symbols.description: A desolate area between West Egg and New York City.
symbols.meaning: Symbolizes the moral and social decay resulting from the uninhibited pursuit of wealth.
symbols.key_quote: This is a valley of ashes—a fantastic farm where ashes grow like wheat into ridges and hills and grotesque gardens.

references.description: The description of the valley as a wasteland.

symbols.name: The Eyes of Doctor T.J. Eckleburg
symbols.description: A billboard with a pair of giant, disembodied eyes.
symbols.meaning: Often interpreted as the eyes of God, watching over the moral decay of society.
symbols.key_quote: But above the grey land and the spasms of bleak dust which drift endlessly over it, you perceive, after a moment, the eyes of Doctor T.J. Eckleburg.

references.description: Wilson refers to the eyes as the eyes of God.

for a moment that my house was on fire. Two o’clock
and the whole corner of the peninsula was blazing with light
which fell unreal on the shrubbery and made thin elongat-
ing glints upon the roadside wires. Turning a corner I saw
